definitions.definition: A short rustling, hissing or whistling sound, often made by friction.
A hissing, sweeping movement through the air, as of an animal's tail.
A sound of liquid flowing inside a container.
A twig or bundle of twigs, used for administering beatings; a switch
A successful basketball shot that does not touch the rim or backboard.
An improvised alcoholic drink made by fermenting whatever ingredients are available.
To make a rustling sound while moving.
To flourish with a swishing sound.
definitions.example: to swish a cane back and forth

definitions.definition: To make a successful basketball shot that does not touch the rim or backboard.
To mince or otherwise to behave in an effeminate manner.
definitions.example: I shall not swish; I'll merely act limp-wristed.

definitions.definition: (transitive) To cause a liquid to move around in a container, or in one's mouth.
definitions.example: Swish the mouthwash around the mouth and between the teeth for one minute.
This restaurant looks very swish — it even has linen tablecloths.

definitions.definition: A hissing or whistling sound of something travelling quickly through the air.
